summary: The contact owns a 1994 Chevrolet Suburban. The contact stated that while driving approximately 35 mph and applying the brake pedal to stop the pedal suddenly extended to the floor causing the vehicle to crash into the rear of a second vehicle. No injuries were reported. A police report was taken at the scene and the vehicle was towed away. The manufacturer and local dealer were not yet notified. The failure mileage was 274,000.

CONSUMER WRITES IN REGARDS TO GM CUSTOMERS AND PASSENGERS THAT USE VEHICLE AIR CONDITIONING HAVE BEEN CONTAMINATED AND/OR POISONED.  *SMD  THE CONSUMER STATED GM DEVELOPED AN AFTER-BLOW RETROFIT KIT TO REMOVE EXCESS WATER FROM THE A/C EVAPORATOR CORE. THE CONSUMER STATED IN DECEMBER 2002, HE WAS IN THE VEHICLE WITH HIS WIFE, WHEN HE TURNED ON THE HEATER, THE AIR HAD MUSTY ODOR AND HE BEGAN HAVING TROUBLE BREATHING. HE TURNED OFF THE HEATER AND OPENED THE WINDOWS. THEY STOPPED A T A LOCAL CHEVROLET DEALER AND INQUIRED ABOUT THE ODOR, AND THEY WERE TOLD IT WAS A DESIGN DEFECT OF HVAC SYSTEM. THE AC EVAPORATOR CORE DID NOT ALLOW WATER TO DISSIPATE/EVAPORATE AND MICROBIAL GROWTH COULD OCCUR WITHIN 24 TO 48 HOURS.  THE CONSUMER STATED THE DEFECT MADE HIS ENTIRE FAMILY SICK. *JB

VEHICLE WAS PARKED WITH THE IGNITION OFF. AFTER APPROXIMATELY 10 MINUTES, A FIRE STARTED IN THE AREA OF THE BATTERY PRECEDED BY THICK WHITE SMOKE. THE FIRE SPREAD TO THE PLASTIC WHEELWELL GUARD AND RIGHT FRONT TIRE ABOUT TWO MINUTES AFTER THE  SMOKE WAS NOTICED. THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE, DASHBOARD, WINDSHIELD, AND FRONT FLOOR PAN AREA WAS DESTROYED BY FIRE.  *TR

THE SEAT BELTS WILL NOT RETRACT WHEN YOU LEAN FORWARD AND THE WIPERS WILL WORK SOMETIMES BUT MOST OF THE TIME THEY WILL NOT TURN ON. THIS REDUCES VISIBILITY WHILE RAINING AND IF IT RESULTS IN A CRASH THE SEAT BELTS MAY NOT WORK PROPERLY TO PROTECT THE PASSENGERS.  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 CHEVROLET SUBURBAN 2500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 25-35 MPH, THE BRAKES WERE ABRUPTLY APPLIED BUT THE VEHICLE DID NOT RESPOND. AS A RESULT, THE CONTACT CRASHED INTO A PRECEDING VEHICLE. THERE WERE NO INJURIES. THE POLICE WERE NOT CONTACTED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INSPECTED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT CONTACTED. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE APPROXIMATELY 170,000.
WINDSHIELD WIPERS WORK INTERMITTENTLY, THERE ARE 2 RECALLS ON WINDSHIELD WIPERS, BUT THIS VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED DUE TO VIN. *AK *JB    *TR

RUSTED BRAKE LINE BLEW OUT AND I HAD WRECK.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 CHEVROLET SUBURBAN.  WHENEVER THE CONTACT ATTEMPTS TO USE THE WINDSHIELD WIPERS, THEY WILL WORK VERY INCONSISTENTLY. THE CONTACT DID NOT NOTICE ANY DIFFERENCES BEFOREHAND AND THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN DIAGNOSED BY THE DEALER.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 60,000 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 50,000. UPDATED 09/29/08*LJ  UPDATED 09/29/08 *JB

DRIVING THE 70 MPH SPEED LIMIT ON AN INTERSTATE HIGHWAY THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR TIRE SUDDENLY WENT FLAT.  THE ROAD WAS SMOOTH, FLAT AND CLEAR OF DEBRIS.  CHUNKS OF RUBBER FLEW IN THE AIR BEHIND ME HITTING UNFORTUNATE MOTOR CYCLES TRAVELING BEHIND ME.  I WAS ABLE PULL OVER FROM THE PASSING LANE TO THE SHOULDER.  THE OUTER SIDE WALL WAS COMPLETELY GONE WITH THE TREAD AND INNER SIDE WALL IN TACT.  I PUT MY SPARE ON AND CONTINUED MY TRIP.  THESE TIRES WERE PURCHASED 18 MOS AGO.  I WILL NOT PUT MY TRUST IN COOPER TIRES AGAIN.  *TR

WE HAVE HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THE SEATBELTS ON OUR 1994 CHEVROLET SUBURBAN.  AFTER CLOSING THE SEATBELTS, THEY HAVE A TENDENCY TO POP OPEN UNEXPECTEDLY AND ESPECIALLY WHEN THE BRAKE IS APPLIED.  (THE FORCE WILL CAUSE THEM TO OPEN.)  WHILE NO ACCIDENTS HAVE OCCURRED, THIS IS ALARMING TO ME BECAUSE IF THERE WAS AN ACCIDENT, THE PEOPLE IN OUR VEHICLE WOULD NOT BE PROTECTED BY SEATBELTS.  *TR

NO REASON WHATSOEVER FOR THIS TO HAPPEN. $300 LATER I HAVE A NEW WINDOW BACK THERE. YESTERDAY THE SAME THING HAPPENS ONLY IT IS ON THE PASSENGER SIDE. THE BRAKES ARE GENERALLY DEFECTTIVE.  I HAVE BEEN IN SEVERAL EMERGENCY AND NON-EMERGENCY SITUATIONS WHERE THE BRAKES HAVE NOT PERFORMED SATISFACTORILY.  ON ONE OCCASION, I NEARLY LOST CONTROL ON THE FREEWAY. ON ANOTHER, ON A WET STREET AT LOW SPEED, I PARTIALLY ENTERED AN INTERSECTION THROUGH A RED LIGHT BECAUSE THE BRAKES WOULD KEEP RELEASING.  WITH RESPECT TO THE ACCIDENT NOTED ABOVE, I WAS ON A FREEWAY ACCESS ROAD GOING ABOUT 45MPH WHEN TRAFFIC UNEXPECTEDLY CAME TO A HALT, AND I, ALONG WITH MOST OF THE OTHER DRIVERS, HAD TO JUMP ON THE BRAKES HARD.  I WAS BRAKING WELL AND STOPPING SHORT OF THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF ME, BUT WHEN THE BRAKE PEDAL PRESSURE INCREASED TO THE POINT OF ENGAGING THE ANTI-LOCK SYSTEM, THE BRAKES ACTUALLY RELEASED CAUSING ME TO LUNGE FORWARD INTO THE VEHICLE IN FRONT OF ME.  ALTHOUGH MANY CARS WERE SCRAMBLING TO STOP, MINE WAS THE ONLY ACCIDENT.  I AM AN EXPERIENCED DRIVER AND I CONSIDER MYSELF A GOOD AND SAFE DRIVER.  I DID NOT RELEASE THE BRAKES--I KNOW HOW ANTI-LOCKS WORK AND I KNOW HOW TO USE THEM.  MY OTHER CAR HAS ANTI-LOCK BRAKES, SO I ALSO KNOW WHAT IT'S LIKE TO HAVE ANTI-LOCK BRAKES THAT WORK WELL.  I RAISED HELL AT THE DEALERSHIP AND HAD THE SERVICE MANAGER AND THEIR HEAD BRAKE GURU TEST THE BRAKES.  THEY CLAIMED THEY WERE FINE AND WORKING PROPERLY.  THEY ARE WRONG.  I RECENTLY READ THAT THE NTSB HAS AN OPEN LONG-TERM INVESTIGATION INTO THESE BRAKES, SO I THOUGHT I WOULD PUT IN MY TWO CENTS TO HELP YOU.  I BOUGHT A DEFECTIVE PRODUCT AS FAR AS I'M CONCERNED.  I'VE LOST MONEY ON COLLISION REPAIRS AND INSURANCE.  I'M AT RISK EVERY DAY AND I KNOW IT.  I'M AT YOUR DISPOSAL SHOULD YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS OR NEED FURTHER INFORMATION.  THANKS.

THE ABS BRAKES SYSTEM ON THE 1994 SUBURBAN WAS UNRELIABLE SINCE THE FIRST MONTH AFTER ORIGINAL PURCHASE.  A TYPICAL SCENARIO IS COMING TO A STOP AT A STOP SIGN OR STOPLIGHT.  THE BRAKES OCCASSIONALLY START PULSING, ALLOWING THE VEHICLE TO TRAVEL AN EXTRA DISTANCE BEFORE STOPPING.  THIS HAS RESULTED IN NEAR MISSES WHERE WE ALMOST REAR-ENDED OTHER VEHICLES AND ON OTHER OCCASSIONS CAME TO A STOP IN THE INTERSECTION.  ALSO, RAILROAD TRACKS ARE PARTICULARLY HAZARDOUS WITH THE SUBURBAN ABS.
THESE BRAKES DO NOT ACT PROPERLY - WHEN TRAVELLING ON THE FREEWAY THE BRAKES SHUDDER WHEN APPLIED AND THEY OFTEN LOCK AND MAKE A YAWNING SOUND.
ABS SYSTEM ISNT WORKING, AND SOMETIMES THE ABS SYSTEM WILL WORK. CONSUMER APPLIED THE BRAKES, AND THE VEHICLE KEPT GOING, CAUSING THE CONSUMER TO REAR END ANOTHER VEHICLE.  *AK

ANTI-LOCK BRAKE SYSTEM HAS "LOCKED UP" REPEATEDLY SINCE PURCHASE (ON AVERAGE, APPROXIMATELY ONCE EVERY TWO WEEKS).  WE'VE EXPLAINED THE PROBLEM TO THE DEALER'S SERVICE DEPARTMENT, BUT HAVE BEEN TOLD THAT THERE'S NO PROBLEM.  "LOCK-UP" OCCURS MOST FREQUENTLY WHEN, DURING LIGHT BRAKING, THE VEHICLE TRAVELS OVER A BUMP (E.G., ROUGH PAVEMENT, MANHOLE COVER).  "LOCK-UP" ALSO HAS OCCURRED DURING MEDIUM TO HEAVY BRAKING ON WET/SLIPPERY SURFACES.  THE VEHICLE APPEARS TO "THINK" THAT THE WHEEL IS SLIPPING AND, INSTEAD OF PULSING, JUST STOPS RESPONDING TO THE BRAKE PEDAL FOR AS MUCH AS 2-3 SECONDS.  I READ THAT THE SMALL GM SUV'S ARE BEING RECALLED FOR SIMILAR-SOUNDING PROBLEMS, BUT WAS DISAPPOINTED TO SEE THAT THE INVESTIGATION IS STILL UNDERWAY FOR SUBURBANS AND FULL-SIZE PICKUP TRUCKS.

BOTH MY WIFE AND I HAVE EXPERIENCED PROBLEM WITH THE BRAKES ON OUR 1994 SURBURBAN.  THE SITUATION HAS OCURRED ON DRY PAVEMENT AND I BELIEVE CAN NOT BE ATTRIBUTED TO EITHER OF US APPLYING THE BRAKES TO HARD OR "PUMPING" THE BRAKES.
